birth_place.zh-cn: 清朝四川省潼川府遂宁县双江镇
birth_place.en: Shuangjiang Town, Suining County, Tongchuan Prefecture, Sichuan Province, Qing Dynasty

death_place.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国北京市中国人民解放军总医院
death_place.en: Chinese PLA General Hospital, Beijing, People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国政治人物，原正国级领导人，中国人民解放军高级将领。曾任中华人民共和国主席、中共中央军委副主席兼秘书长等职，被认为是邓小平主政时期的“中共八大元老”之一。
description.en: A Chinese Communist Party and People's Republic of China political figure, a former national-level leader, and a senior general of the People's Liberation Army. He served as President of the People's Republic of China, Vice Chairman and Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission, and is considered one of the 'Eight Elders of the CCP' during Deng Xiaoping's era.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第二代中央领导集体的核心，中华人民共和国的实际最高领导人之一。
description.en: The core of the second generation of the central leadership of the Communist Party of China, and one of the paramount leaders of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第三代中央领导集体的核心，曾任中共中央总书记、中华人民共和国主席、中央军委主席。
description.en: The core of the third generation of the central leadership of the Communist Party of China, who served as General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, President of the People's Republic of China, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国中央军事委员会

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家军事机关，领导全国武装力量。
description.en: The state military organ of the People's Republic of China, which leads the nation's armed forces.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央军事委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会领导下的最高军事领导机构。
description.en: The highest military leading body under the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家元首职位。
description.en: The position of the head of state of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党及中华人民共和国前主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国主席。
description.en: One of the former principal leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as President of the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党及中华人民共和国的领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国副主席。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as Vice President of the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中国人民解放军和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Liberation Army, and the People's Republic of China.

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会办公厅

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的办事机构，负责中共中央的日常文秘、机要、信息、调研、警卫等工作。
description.en: The administrative body of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, responsible for daily secretarial, confidential, information, research, and security work for the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆的妻子，参加了二万五千里长征的女红军，曾任中央戏剧学院党委书记、副院长。
description.en: Wife of Yang Shangkun, a female Red Army soldier who participated in the Long March, and former Party Secretary and Vice President of the Central Academy of Drama.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆长子，原国防科工委某研究所所长。
description.en: Eldest son of Yang Shangkun, former director of an institute under the Commission for Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆次子，著名摄影家，现任中国宋庆龄基金会副主席。
description.en: Second son of Yang Shangkun, a renowned photographer, currently serving as Vice Chairman of the China Soong Ching Ling Foundation.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆女儿，曾为总参谋部少将。
description.en: Daughter of Yang Shangkun, a former Major General in the General Staff Department.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆女婿，中国保利集团公司党委副书记、董事。
description.en: Son-in-law of Yang Shangkun, Deputy Party Secretary and Director of China Poly Group Corporation.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆的胞弟，解放军上将，曾任中共中央军委秘书长兼总政治部主任。
description.en: Younger brother of Yang Shangkun, a PLA General, who served as Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission and Director of the General Political Department.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪20年代在苏联莫斯科创办的一所大学，为中国国民党和中国共产党培养了许多政治人才。
description.en: A university founded in Moscow, Soviet Union in the 1920s, which trained many political talents for both the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 1978年起由邓小平主导的在中国大陆推行的一系列经济及政治体制改革政策。
description.en: A series of economic and political reforms in mainland China initiated by Deng Xiaoping starting in 1978.

description.zh-cn: 1989年发生在中国北京的学生民主运动，最终被政府以武力清场镇压。
description.en: A student-led pro-democracy movement in Beijing, China in 1989, which was ultimately suppressed by the government with military force.

description.zh-cn: 1992年春，已退休的邓小平对中国南方城市进行的一次巡视，对推动中国的改革开放起到了关键作用。
description.en: In the spring of 1992, retired Deng Xiaoping's tour of southern Chinese cities, which played a key role in advancing China's reform and opening up.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的在中国发生的一场政治运动。
description.en: A political movement in China initiated and led by Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命前夕的一起政治案件，彭真、罗瑞卿、陆定一、杨尚昆被打成“反党集团”。
description.en: A political case on the eve of the Cultural Revolution, in which Peng Zhen, Luo Ruiqing, Lu Dingyi, and Yang Shangkun were labeled as an 'anti-Party clique'.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国主席，在文化大革命中被迫害致死。
description.en: One of the former principal leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as President of the PRC and was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 指控杨尚昆、杨白冰兄弟意图夺取军权并为六四翻案的政治事件，导致二人在中共十四大后被剥夺军权。
description.en: A political incident involving accusations that brothers Yang Shangkun and Yang Baibing intended to seize military power and reverse the verdict on the Tiananmen Square protests, leading to their removal from military power after the 14th National Congress of the CPC.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人之一，曾任中共中央总书记和国务院总理，因在六四事件中持温和态度被免职。
description.en: One of the former principal leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee and Premier of the State Council. He was dismissed for his moderate stance during the Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人之一，曾长期担任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: One of the former principal leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as the Premier of the State Council of the PRC for a long period.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的早期领导人之一，位列中共第一代中央领导集体“五大书记”。
description.en: One of the early leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, ranked among the 'Five Great Secretaries' of the first generation of the CPC central leadership.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的早期领导人之一，曾任国务院副总理。
description.en: One of the early leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as Vice Premier of the State Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军的创始人和主要领导者之一，中华人民共和国十大元帅之一。
description.en: One of the founders and main leaders of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and one of the Ten Marshals of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 指1961年，时任中共中央办公厅主任的杨尚昆等人，因在毛泽东专列上安装录音设备而引发的政治事件。
description.en: A political incident in 1961 where Yang Shangkun, then Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee, and others installed recording equipment on Mao Zedong's special train.

description.zh-cn: 大韩民国第13任总统，在其任内与中华人民共和国建立外交关系。
description.en: The 13th President of the Republic of Korea, during whose term diplomatic relations were established with the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 日本第125代天皇。
description.en: The 125th Emperor of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军主力从长江以南的根据地向陕甘根据地进行的战略大转移。
description.en: The strategic retreat of the main forces of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army from their bases south of the Yangtze River to the Shaanxi-Gansu Soviet.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军在土地革命战争时期的一支主力部队。
description.en: A main force unit of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army during the Agrarian Revolutionary War.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军的创始人和主要领导者之一，中华人民共和国十大元帅之一。
description.en: One of the founders and main leaders of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and one of the Ten Marshals of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆的四哥，中国共产党党员，在三·三一惨案中被四川军阀杀害。
description.en: Yang Shangkun's fourth elder brother, a member of the Communist Party of China, who was killed by a Sichuan warlord in the March 31st Incident.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆的四妹，廖汉生的妻子。
description.en: Yang Shangkun's fourth younger sister, wife of Liao Hansheng.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国中央军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆担任中华人民共和国中央军事委员会副主席，期间主席先后为邓小平和江泽民。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the PRC, under Chairmen Deng Xiaoping and later Jiang Zemin.

relationships.target: 中国共产党中央军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆担任中国共产党中央军事委员会副主席，期间主席先后为邓小平和江泽民。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as Vice Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission, under Chairmen Deng Xiaoping and later Jiang Zemin.

relationships.target: 中国共产党中央军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆曾两次担任中共中央军委秘书长，分别在毛泽东和邓小平担任主席期间。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission on two occasions, under Chairmen Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping respectively.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆担任中华人民共和国第四任主席。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as the 4th President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆长期担任中共中央办公厅主任，在毛泽东担任党主席期间负责中央枢要工作。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as the Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee for an extended period, handling key central affairs during Mao Zedong's chairmanship.

description.zh-cn: 在邓小平担任中央军委主席期间，杨尚昆先后担任军委秘书长和副主席，是邓小平主政时期的“中共八大元老”之一，也是其改革开放政策的坚定支持者。
description.en: During Deng Xiaoping's tenure as Chairman of the Central Military Commission, Yang Shangkun served as Secretary-General and Vice Chairman of the commission. He was one of the 'Eight Elders of the CCP' during Deng's era and a staunch supporter of his reform and opening-up policy.

position.en: Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission

description.zh-cn: 在江泽民接任中央军委主席后，杨尚昆继续担任副主席。
description.en: After Jiang Zemin took over as Chairman of the Central Military Commission, Yang Shangkun continued to serve as Vice Chairman.

description.zh-cn: 在毛泽东担任中共中央主席和军委主席期间，杨尚昆担任中共中央办公厅主任和中央军委秘书长。
description.en: During Mao Zedong's tenure as Chairman of the CPC Central Committee and the Central Military Commission, Yang Shangkun served as Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee and Secretary-General of the Central Military Commission.

position.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国副主席
position.en: Vice President of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 在杨尚昆担任中华人民共和国主席期间，王震担任副主席。
description.en: While Yang Shangkun was President of the People's Republic of China, Wang Zhen served as Vice President.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆与李伯钊于1929年在苏联莫斯科结婚。
description.en: Yang Shangkun and Li Bozhao married in Moscow, Soviet Union in 1929.

description.zh-cn: 杨白冰是杨尚昆的胞弟。
description.en: Yang Baibing is Yang Shangkun's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 杨暗公是杨尚昆的四哥。
description.en: Yang Angong was Yang Shangkun's fourth elder brother.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚璞是杨尚昆的四妹。
description.en: Yang Shangpu was Yang Shangkun's fourth younger sister.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆被认为是邓小平“改革开放”政策的军方坚定支持者。
description.en: Yang Shangkun was considered a staunch supporter of Deng Xiaoping's 'Reform and Opening-Up' policy from within the military.

description.zh-cn: 杨白冰被认为是邓小平“改革开放”政策的军方坚定支持者。
description.en: Yang Baibing was considered a staunch supporter of Deng Xiaoping's 'Reform and Opening-Up' policy from within the military.

description.zh-cn: 作为国家主席和中央军委副主席，杨尚昆最终表明坚决支持邓小平和李鹏，支持了对六四天安门事件的武力镇压。
description.en: As President of the PRC and Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission, Yang Shangkun ultimately expressed firm support for Deng Xiaoping and Li Peng, backing the armed suppression of the Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 1992年春，杨尚昆陪同邓小平作南方巡视，并公开表态军方坚定支持改革开放，为南巡提供了支持。
description.en: In the spring of 1992, Yang Shangkun accompanied Deng Xiaoping on his Southern Tour and publicly stated the military's firm support for reform and opening-up, thereby supporting the tour.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命开始后，杨尚昆被列为“彭、罗、陆、杨反党集团”成员，被撤销一切职务并受到监护审查长达12年。
description.en: After the Cultural Revolution began, Yang Shangkun was labeled a member of the 'Peng, Luo, Lu, Yang Anti-Party Clique', stripped of all his posts, and held under custodial investigation for 12 years.

description.zh-cn: 因1961年的窃听器事件，杨尚昆于1965年被免去中共中央办公厅主任职务，改任广东省委书记处书记。
description.en: Due to the 1961 bugging incident, Yang Shangkun was removed from his post as Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee in 1965 and reassigned as a secretary of the Guangdong Provincial Committee Secretariat.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆被划为“彭、罗、陆、杨反党集团”成员，这是他在文革中受到迫害的直接原因。
description.en: Yang Shangkun was classified as a member of the 'Peng, Luo, Lu, Yang Anti-Party Clique', which was the direct cause of his persecution during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1966年6月27日，时任国家主席刘少奇在一次座谈会上将杨尚昆定性为“反对毛主席，反对毛泽东思想”的“彭、罗、陆、杨”成员之一。
description.en: On June 27, 1966, then-President Liu Shaoqi, at a symposium, characterized Yang Shangkun as a member of the 'Peng, Luo, Lu, Yang' group who 'opposed Chairman Mao and Mao Zedong Thought'.

description.zh-cn: 经过杨家将事件后，杨尚昆在1992年10月卸任中共中央政治局委员和中央军委副主席，并于次年卸任国家主席后退休。
description.en: Following the 'Yang Family Generals' incident, Yang Shangkun stepped down as a member of the Politburo and Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission in October 1992, and retired after stepping down as President the following year.

description.zh-cn: 1945年10月，任弼时提议由杨尚昆接替李富春担任中央副秘书长、中央书记处办公厅主任职务。
description.en: In October 1945, Ren Bishi proposed that Yang Shangkun take over from Li Fuchun as Deputy Secretary-General of the Central Committee and Director of the General Office of the Central Secretariat.

description.zh-cn: 1945年12月，叶剑英为杨尚昆要来了一张毛泽东亲笔签名的中央军委秘书长的“委任状”，正式任命了该职务。
description.en: In December 1945, Ye Jianying obtained a 'letter of appointment' for the position of Secretary-General of the Central Military Commission, personally signed by Mao Zedong, for Yang Shangkun, formally appointing him to the post.

description.zh-cn: 1992年邓小平南巡后，杨尚昆曾替邓小平捎话劝说赵紫阳“认错”复出工作。
description.en: After Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour in 1992, Yang Shangkun conveyed a message from Deng to Zhao Ziyang, urging him to 'admit his mistakes' and return to work.

description.zh-cn: 江泽民接替杨尚昆出任中华人民共和国主席。
description.en: Jiang Zemin succeeded Yang Shangkun as President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆接替李先念出任中华人民共和国主席。
description.en: Yang Shangkun succeeded Li Xiannian as President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 时任国家主席杨尚昆在北京会见了来华访问的大韩民国总统卢泰愚。
description.en: Then-President Yang Shangkun met with visiting President of the Republic of Korea, Roh Tae-woo, in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 时任国家主席杨尚昆在北京会见了来华访问的日本天皇明仁。
description.en: Then-President Yang Shangkun met with visiting Emperor of Japan, Akihito, in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆作为红三军团政治委员，与彭德怀共同率领部队参加了长征。
description.en: As the political commissar of the Third Red Army Group, Yang Shangkun, along with Peng Dehuai, led the troops to participate in the Long March.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆和彭德怀共同率领红三军团参加长征，杨尚昆任政治委员。
description.en: Yang Shangkun and Peng Dehuai jointly led the Third Red Army Group during the Long March, with Yang serving as the political commissar.
